replies.text: Maybe I am biased but the GitHub copilot Is mostly used within VSC and there users have the choice to use other copilots. Google Gemini is free and codium as well. Giving users the ability to choose the model behind GitHub copilot is just staying competitive

There are a 100 competitors to copilot allowing the user to select from pretty much any of the major models using your own API keys, and some of them are substantially more advanced than copilot. This really feels like a reaction to tools like Cline, Cursor, Aider, etc.

Allowing Claude makes sense because its arguably the best coding AI for the cost. But allowing Gemini is surprising, doesnt Gemini exclusively run on Googles TPU hardware? Microsoft and Google are in a pretty fierce battle over who can build up the most compute infrastructure.

I dont even use gh copilot because Claude is superior I will have to try it out again now if they allow claude This is probably the reason they have been forced to do this, openai is the wrong horse to back imo
But do any of them allow whisper like speech to text, which is in chatgpt?
Is there a Claude plugin already?

replies.text: Imagine the gains youd make if you simply didnt invest in companies with scandals or sour sentiment.

BABA is up 25 over the past year while VOO is up 38 so thats not the success story youre making it out to be. Success in the market isnt just making a profit. If youre not beating the SP then youre losing. Bear in mind that while youre sitting on cash waiting for the next piece of bad news, that money isnt appreciating like it would with a set it and forget it approach. Also every time one of your picks starts to plateau and you decide to sell you have to give the tax man his cut which means you have less to reinvest. If you have to sell before youve owned the stock for a year then youll have to pay capital gains which will cut into your profit even more. All these things plus the fact that there isnt a guarantee that a stock will bounce back from bad news means that this is probably not the slam dunk you think it is. You may get lucky a few times but its probably not a sustainable investing strategy.
its an ETF world and we just live in it. results dont matter because of the sheer amount of macro spend in buying index and baskets. thats why mag7 and sp is unstoppable right now.
Its funny, I just keep buying NVDA and they dont have any scandals.

When the BABA scandal started CCP intervention and Jack Ma disappearing, it dropped massively it went from 300 USD to 220. If you had applied your genius thinking then... youd still be down 60. The initial big drop in SMCI was from 100 to 80. Youd still be down 40. You are not talking about buying stocks when bad news drop. You are talking about PERFECTLY timing the bottom of crashes. Congratulations if you are able to do it. Most people will lose their shirts trying to catch the bottom on a falling knife.
Any strategy that makes you money sanely is a good strategy
Even better buy stocks that are algorithmically correlated to other stocks that have a bad news day and sell off even though the news has nothing to do with them. This happens all the time.
More value has been lost in cash waiting for a crash than from the crash itself. Peter Lynch
Sometimes a stock is down not because its going to go back up, but because the business sucks. Does SNOW or INTC have a solid plan to profitability?
Why didnt you pull trigger on INTC? its clearly a winning strategy.

The best thing I did all year was dump SNOW after the first crash. The other day when ASML shit the bed I loaded up. Ive been buying up goog. One one my strategies now is waiting on larger corrections or individual stock crashes, I think youre onto something. But Snow just seems like a shit pick but just my humble opinion.
If you like the idea of contrarian investing, small cap value funds like AVUV might match your methodology without requiring you to invest a ton of effort
But thats when you can get the best prices.
Sometimes stock picking is just fun even if you dont beat the indexes. If I underperformed I would probably still be doing it.

About 75 of my portfolio is indexed or in value stocks and bonds. I shoulda said that up front. The rest, I must admit, I gamble with. I do try and avoid capital gains, but the gist of my gambling strategy is WAITING for relatively solid companies to poop their pants. Youre probably right. Instead of sitting on cash I oughta just set it and forget it but... Its FUN to gamble?? Fun with a lower case f, that is. Getting fucked is Uppercased, of course. Trust me, Im not entirely convinced I know what Im doing.
Wen music stop?
Are you not familiar with the round tripping allegations?
CRWD is a perfect example for this. Look at it now 50 up from crash.
Yeah but youre paying for the fun by making less money in a more time consuming way
No, and the stock price isnt either.
But that wasnt guaranteed. Company very realistically could have burned out after that.
Taxes and death The only things in life that are guaranteed

replies.text: The only regret I see here is not including a fund, but youve done well regardless.

Old dood here. The stock market has made a monkey out of me twice big losses. If I knew 35 years ago what I know today I would of bought an SP index and forgot about it. Individual stock picking was not my forte.

I would sell everything but the first 3 holdings. Consolidate and put into an index. You can do some individual stocks 50 and index 50 to be really safe. You want to preserve capital. You did a really good job being balanced in your positions.
Likely. Did you do the actual math?

Sorry first 4 holdings, I didnt see Amazon in there. Keep Amazon, Google, Tesla, Apple and build out from there. I do MAG7 and then 50 SPY. When I add, I look to see what Im down on and then add funds appropriately.

Its really difficult to do that math on a DCA basis. But by picking two points, yes, I calculated the different in return on investment. If I had invested my entire principle 3 years ago today I would be up 20.xx, but if we take VOOs 1 year return Aug 2, 2023, VOOs return is 17. My point is that if I had simply DCAd my capital into VOO, I wouldve also invested in the low points creating a return likely 25 without much effort.
Was gonna say lol google is not bad either. I agree though.
Yeah its something every single investor realizes over their time picking stocks its fun sometimes, addictive gambling and not worth the stress.

replies.text: deleted

I think people keep overlooking one single thing thats skewing the US markets and this is mainly in the US, that is the 401k generalisation and passive investing boom. Thats a lot of capital deployed and monthly capital injection. Theres no need for a new theory its mostly just that.

My current understanding is that efficiency in the EMH is just the speed at which information is disseminated to the market participants as a whole. What participants do with that information is up to them. The democratization of the stock market has in general decreased price volatility and increased predictability, removing arbitrage opportunities. I do wonder how both EMHAMH factor in disinformation and misinformation into their models.
Thanks, ChatGPT.

Robinhood charging option traders 57x what other brokers do through hidden fee known as Payment for Order Flow

National Best Bid Offer AKA the spread between buyer and seller. When it comes to options there is often a large spread and the trade can get executed between that. So for example a Call might have a Bid of 2.25 and an ask of 2.40 so thats a 15 cent spread Robinhood works with Market makers and executes in between and often keeps a big piece of the pie the study shows they keep 57x more than other brokers but advertise it as a free trade because they dont charge an up front commission. Hoodwinked
How do you think they make so much money giving away trades hoodwinking the masses

we had our 50% drop, and it was over 60%. All over a short term inventory issue that had zero bearing on the long term trajectory of the business. I don't think we'll need to endure another one. But 20's and maybe 30's, % decline, those will happen. We now have a visionary food retailer on board. We have retailers ordering product in general merchandise preparing to follow Walmart's lead. And how long can our door dock logistics customer wait before they follow UPS's lead and tag at the package level. Cooters

PI management on their Q2 call let everyone know that Q4 would be soft because they ship ahead of the holdiay season in Q3.  Still Q3 beat and even Q4 guidance is higher.PI had a large increase in Q3 with no real news, on mostly low volume.  It was going to correct.  These corrections drive out the weak investors and speculators.  Most private investors lose in the market because they buy in when everything looks great and dump when the stock retreats for fear of going lower.  Buffet says 10 years and expect a 50% price reduction along the way.  Hope that doesnt happen but PI has hundreds of patents built on top of other patents going back 20 years.  That can't be easily duplicated, NXP tried and lost, a 61 billion marketcap company.  That tells everyone not to try it.  So it is the only company producing RAIN RFID ICs.PI is growing year over year with growth in all their sectors and they are the technology.  DPP coming. Qualcomm coming, Walmart adopting, and many others will follow.  m800 coming on line, and food starting to adopt.The CEO and founder is telling us this will take years, but steady growth for years is exactly why I have a position in PI.PI tanked in 2003.  Then what happened?
